intro: Metamyriactis sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim metamyriactis, is a rare flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of India. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small white to yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forest understories. Its botanical features include a slender stem and a clustered inflorescence, making it a distinctive member of its family. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
